00:00:05:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:05:220000.Dialogue: Gentlemen, I put it to you: the worst tapioca pudding is better than the best pudding of any other flavor.

00:00:13:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:13:130000.Dialogue: First off, that is axiomatically wrong because the best pudding is chocolate.

00:00:18:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:18:100000.Dialogue: Secondly, the organic structure of tapioca makes it a jiggling bowl of potential death. - It is extracted from the plant...

00:00:22:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:22:230000.Dialogue: - I'm thinking of growing a mustache.

00:00:28:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:28:170000.Dialogue: No kidding? Fu Manchu, a handlebar, pencil?

00:00:31:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:31:160000.Dialogue: - I'm not sure yet. - George Clooney has one now.

00:00:33:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:33:210000.Dialogue: - Really? I once saw him shopping at Ralph's. He was buying tequila.

00:00:40:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:40:080000.Dialogue: You'd thinka guy like that would have some kind of booze lackey.

00:00:48:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:48:090000.Dialogue: This is cruel. We'd better let him finish before his head explodes.

00:00:54:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:54:020000.Dialogue: Tapioca is extracted from the root of the plant manihot esculenta! Due to a high concentration of cyanide, it is poisonous in its raw form and lethal if prepared improperly!

00:01:06:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:06:020000.Dialogue: It is also indigenous to Brazil as is the cocoa bean, from which we get chocolate, the best pudding. You promised you wouldn't do that anymore!

00:01:16:230000.Speaker: Kripke
00:01:16:230000.Dialogue: Heard about your latest anti-proton decay experiment. 20,000 data runs and no statistically significant results. Very impressive.

00:01:28:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:28:020000.Dialogue: Don't feel bad. Negative results are still results.

00:01:35:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:35:230000.Dialogue: Please don't cheer me up anymore.

00:01:37:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:37:190000.Dialogue: Don't let him get to you. It's Kripke.

00:01:43:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:43:020000.Dialogue: That's why he eats by himself instead of sitting here at the cool table.

00:01:52:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:52:200000.Dialogue: It's true Kripke lacks the basic social skills that we take for granted.

00:01:58:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:58:040000.Dialogue: But he also controls the new open science grid computer that I need to use to run some simulations of structure formation in the early universe.

00:02:04:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:04:230000.Dialogue: Good luck getting time on it. The only people he lets use it are his friends.

00:02:08:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:08:220000.Dialogue: Then the solution is simple. I shall befriend him. What would you say to the idea of you and I becoming friends?

00:02:20:090000.Speaker: Kripke
00:02:20:090000.Dialogue: I would say I have no interest in becoming your friend.

00:02:25:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:25:150000.Dialogue: Really? That seems rather shortsighted coming from someone who is generally considered altogether unlikable.

00:02:33:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:33:080000.Dialogue: Why don't you take some time to reconsider?

00:02:39:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:39:170000.Dialogue: I think we're off to a terrific start.

00:03:07:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:07:060000.Dialogue: There you go. Now any e-mail from Wolowitz will go right into your spam folder.

00:03:12:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:12:200000.Dialogue: Thanks. The e-mail doesn't bother me as much as the vacation pictures of him in a bathing suit.

00:03:18:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:18:100000.Dialogue: Yeah, I got the same one, and that's not a bathing suit. It's a tan line.

00:03:31:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:31:120000.Dialogue: I am leaving a message for Barry Kripke. It was pleasant seeing you today in the cafeteria. I saw that you purchased the chef's salad. Apparently, you did not know that the chef's salad is kitchen trickery to utilize scrap meat.

00:03:50:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:50:110000.Dialogue: Nevertheless, I hope you enjoyed it. I'm following up on our pending friendship and I look forward to hearing from you regarding its status. Sheldon Cooper.

00:04:07:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:07:090000.Dialogue: He's trying to make a new friend.

00:04:11:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:11:020000.Dialogue: Unless he makes one out of wood like Geppetto, I don't think it's gonna happen.

00:04:16:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:16:230000.Dialogue: How did you guys become friends?

00:04:18:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:18:210000.Dialogue: There was a flyer on the bulletin board at the university: Roommate wanted. Whistlers need not apply.

00:04:34:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:34:090000.Dialogue: What about Howard and Raj? How did he become friends with them?

00:04:37:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:37:030000.Dialogue: I don't know. How do carbon atoms form a benzene ring? Proximity and valence electrons.

00:04:43:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:43:230000.Dialogue: Well, sure, when you put it that way.

00:04:47:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:47:070000.Dialogue: But it all worked out, right?

00:04:49:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:49:100000.Dialogue: I suppose. I do miss whistling, though.

00:05:25:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:25:050000.Dialogue: Yes, well, that is a good question.

00:05:28:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:28:090000.Dialogue: But is this really the best way to figure it out?

00:05:31:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:31:050000.Dialogue: I agree. The social sciences are largely hokum.

00:05:34:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:34:110000.Dialogue: But short of putting electrodes in your brain and monitoring your response to my companionship, this is the best I can do.

00:05:41:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:41:180000.Dialogue: Okay, Question one: Rank the following aspects of Sheldon Cooper in order of appeal: Intelligence; ruthless attention to hygiene; playfulness; JAVA applet writing?

00:05:55:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:55:070000.Dialogue: I know, I may have started out with a fairly obvious one; an aspect of my most appealing trait: playfulness.

00:06:02:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:02:180000.Dialogue: Go ahead and rank that number one. I'm afraid you're on your own for the rest. It should take you no more than three hours.

00:06:09:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:09:020000.Dialogue: Wait. How many questions are on this thing?

00:06:13:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:13:230000.Dialogue: Don't worry. In deference to you, I kept them all at a high school graduate reading level.

00:06:24:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:24:230000.Dialogue: Honey, did you ever consider making friends by being, I don't know, pleasant?

00:06:31:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:31:000000.Dialogue: That's certainly a thought-provoking hypothesis. May I suggest it as the topic for your essay?

00:06:42:180000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:06:42:180000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:06:48:220000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:06:48:220000.Speaker: Leonard

00:06:50:190000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:06:50:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:50:190000.Dialogue: You answered the multiple choice questions in a pattern: A-B-B-A-C. A-B-B-A-C.

00:07:00:080000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:07:00:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:00:080000.Dialogue: Oh, you picked up on that?

00:07:03:090000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:07:03:090000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:07:04:220000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:07:04:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:04:220000.Dialogue: Come on. There's over 200 questions. And look at some of these things. Sheldon is to camaraderie as the space shuttle is to blank?

00:07:14:040000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:07:14:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:14:040000.Dialogue: There are a number of acceptable answers. For example, C: Near-Earth transport. But certainly not B: Avocado rancher.

00:07:23:080000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:07:23:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:23:080000.Dialogue: And your essay suggesting that I'd have better luck making friends if I wait till the Cylons take over?

00:07:29:170000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:07:29:170000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:07:31:160000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:07:31:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:31:160000.Dialogue: Hold on. I put some real work into that.

00:07:33:170000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:07:33:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:33:170000.Dialogue: Yes, well, it's better than what Wolowitz did. He drew a raccoon with what appears to be a distended scrotum.

00:07:42:180000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:07:42:180000.Speaker: Leonard

00:07:45:090000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:07:45:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:45:090000.Dialogue: Until you get to the scrotum.

00:07:48:010000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:07:48:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:48:010000.Dialogue: What hope do I have for establishing new relationships given that my current friends apparently could not take a few hours out of their lives to help me?

00:07:55:120000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:07:55:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:55:120000.Dialogue: I'm not going to defend a big-balled raccoon.

00:07:59:070000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:07:59:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:59:070000.Dialogue: I don't see how you could.

00:08:01:130000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:08:01:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:01:130000.Dialogue: What I'm trying to say is that maybe you can't approach this as a purely intellectual exercise.

00:08:07:200000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:08:07:200000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:08:11:050000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:08:11:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:11:050000.Dialogue: Remember when you tried to learn how to swim using the Internet?

00:08:16:000000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:08:16:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:16:000000.Dialogue: I did learn how to swim.

00:08:18:130000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:08:18:130000.Speaker: Leonard

00:08:20:170000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:08:20:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:20:170000.Dialogue: The skills are transferable. I just have no interest in going in the water.

00:08:26:050000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:08:26:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:26:050000.Dialogue: - Then why learn how to swim?

00:08:33:050000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:08:33:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:33:050000.Dialogue: But you do bring up an interesting point. I don't have to break new ground here. I'm sure much of the research already exists.

00:08:39:200000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:08:39:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:39:200000.Dialogue: No, no, my point is, if you want to learn how to make friends, then just go out to a coffee shop or a museum. Meet people. Talk to them. Take an interest in their lives.

00:08:50:230000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:08:50:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:50:230000.Dialogue: That's insane on the face of it.

00:08:54:220000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:08:54:220000.Speaker: Leonard

00:09:03:040000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is reading one of the questionnaires. He tuts.
00:09:03:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:03:040000.Dialogue: Why don't you just lie down on the floor and swim there?

00:09:10:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:10:210000.Dialogue: Coping with the Death of a Loved One.

00:09:30:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:30:090000.Dialogue: It's just as well. She smelled like mothballs.

00:09:33:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:33:230000.Dialogue: If you're gonna start sniffing people, I'm gonna go get a hot pretzel.

00:09:39:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:39:090000.Dialogue: Excuse me. Do you have any books about making friends?

00:09:43:190000.Speaker: Employee
00:09:43:190000.Dialogue: Yeah, but they're all for little kids.

00:09:46:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:46:000000.Dialogue: I assume the skills can be extrapolated and transferred.

00:09:49:050000.Speaker: Employee
00:09:49:050000.Dialogue: I guess. They're right over there by the wooden train set.

00:10:13:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:13:020000.Dialogue: Bernie Bunny Has Two Daddies Now.

00:10:21:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:21:020000.Dialogue: Gerry the Gerbil and the Bullies on the Bus. Read it. Not helpful.

00:10:28:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:28:210000.Dialogue: Here we go. Stu the Cockatoo Is New at the Zoo.

00:10:35:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:35:040000.Dialogue: Author Sarah Carpenter lives in Fort Wayne, Indiana with her husband and best friend, Mark, and their cockatoo Stu.

00:10:46:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:46:010000.Dialogue: Hardly makes her an expert in making friends, wouldn't you agree?

00:10:49:080000.Speaker: girl
00:10:49:080000.Dialogue: I don't like birds. They scare me.

00:10:52:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:52:110000.Dialogue: Me, too. Most people don't see it.

00:11:10:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:10:230000.Dialogue: Say, maybe sometime you and I could go see monkeys together. - Would you like that?

00:11:20:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:20:140000.Dialogue: I'm making friends with this little girl. - What's your name?

00:11:24:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:24:200000.Dialogue: Hi, Rebecca. I'm your new friend, Sheldon.

00:11:29:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:29:160000.Dialogue: - We were really hitting it off.

00:11:37:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:37:060000.Dialogue: I'm curious. In the How well do you know Sheldon section, what did you put for his favorite amino acid?

00:11:45:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:45:050000.Dialogue: Damn it, I had lysine and changed it.

00:11:48:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:48:120000.Dialogue: Good, you're just in time. I believe I've isolated the algorithm for making friends.

00:11:54:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:54:110000.Dialogue: Sheldon, there is no algorithm for making friends.

00:11:57:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:57:070000.Dialogue: Hear him out. If he's really onto something, we could open a booth at Comic-Con. Make a fortune.

00:12:03:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:03:150000.Dialogue: See, my initial approach to Kripke had the same deficiencies as those that plagued Stu the Cockatoo when he was new at the zoo.

00:12:16:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:16:030000.Dialogue: It's a terrific book. I've distilled its essence into a simple flow chart that will guide me through the process.

00:12:22:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:22:090000.Dialogue: Have you thought about putting him in a crate while you're out of the apartment?

00:12:27:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:27:130000.Dialogue: Hello, Kripke? Sheldon Cooper here. It occurred to me you hadn't returned any of my calls because I hadn't offered any concrete suggestions for pursuing our friendship. Perhaps the two of us might share a meal together.

00:12:42:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:42:130000.Dialogue: I see. Well, then perhaps you'd have time for a hot beverage?

00:12:48:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:48:020000.Dialogue: Popular choices include tea, coffee, cocoa. I see. No, wait. Don't hang up yet. What about a recreational activity? I bet we share some common interests. Tell me an interest of yours. Really? On actual horses?

00:13:07:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:07:080000.Dialogue: Tell me another interest of yours.

00:13:10:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:10:100000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. I have no desire to get in the water till I absolutely have to.

00:13:14:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:14:180000.Dialogue: Tell me another interest of yours.

00:13:21:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:21:130000.Dialogue: Interesting, but isn't ventriloquism by definition a solo activity?

00:13:26:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:26:200000.Dialogue: Tell me another interest of yours. Is there any chance you like monkeys?

00:13:34:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:34:160000.Dialogue: What is wrong with you? Everybody likes monkeys.

00:13:38:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:38:230000.Dialogue: Hang on, Kripke. A loop counter and an escape to the least objectionable activity. Howard, that's brilliant.

00:13:52:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:52:150000.Dialogue: Gee, why can't Sheldon make friends?

00:13:56:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:56:130000.Dialogue: All right, Kripke, that last interest strikes me as the least objectionable, and I would like to propose that we do that together. Tomorrow. Yes, I'll pay.

00:14:08:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:08:070000.Dialogue: All right, good-bye. All right. Time to learn rock climbing.

00:14:22:220000.Scene: Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
00:14:22:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:22:220000.Dialogue: You know, I am a fan of ventriloquism.

00:14:26:140000.Scene: Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
00:14:26:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:26:140000.Dialogue: Maybe you, me and your dummy could go get a hot beverage. He could talk while you drink.

00:14:33:090000.Scene: Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
00:14:33:090000.Speaker: Kripke
00:14:33:090000.Dialogue: Nope. I wanna climb some rocks.

00:14:40:180000.Scene: Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
00:14:40:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:40:180000.Dialogue: This appears significantly more monolithic than it did on my laptop.

00:14:46:190000.Scene: Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
00:14:46:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:46:190000.Dialogue: One expects to see hominids learning to use bones as weapons.

00:14:51:160000.Scene: Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
00:14:51:160000.Speaker: Kripke

00:15:00:020000.Scene: Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
00:15:00:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:00:020000.Dialogue: What would you say is the minimum altitude I need to achieve to cement our newfound friendship?

00:15:05:190000.Scene: Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
00:15:05:190000.Speaker: Kripke
00:15:05:190000.Dialogue: They have birthday parties here. Little kids climb this.

00:15:10:230000.Scene: Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
00:15:10:230000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:17:000000.Scene: Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
00:15:17:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:17:000000.Dialogue: So is this your entire job? Your parents must be so proud.

00:15:23:030000.Scene: Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
00:15:23:030000.Speaker: Kripke

00:15:38:190000.Scene: Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
00:15:38:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:38:190000.Dialogue: This isn't so bad. It's like vertical swimming.

00:15:45:010000.Scene: Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
00:15:45:010000.Speaker: Kripke
00:15:45:010000.Dialogue: Look at you. - You're almost halfway to the top.

00:15:46:020000.Scene: Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
00:15:46:020000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:51:010000.Scene: Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
00:15:51:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:51:010000.Dialogue: I was wrong. It is a fear of heights.

00:15:55:010000.Scene: Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
00:15:55:010000.Speaker: Kripke

00:16:01:130000.Scene: Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
00:16:01:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:01:130000.Dialogue: - What part of inverse tangent function approaching an asymptote did you not understand?

00:16:06:150000.Scene: Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
00:16:06:150000.Speaker: Kripke
00:16:06:150000.Dialogue: I understood all of it. I'm not a moron.

00:16:09:080000.Scene: Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
00:16:09:080000.Speaker: Kripke

00:16:11:070000.Scene: Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
00:16:11:070000.Speaker: Kripke

00:16:15:100000.Scene: Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
00:16:15:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:15:100000.Dialogue: No, that doesn't seem any more likely.

00:16:18:170000.Scene: Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
00:16:18:170000.Speaker: Kripke

00:16:20:100000.Scene: Rock climbing centre. Sheldon and Kripke are watching someone descend the practice wall.
00:16:20:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:20:100000.Dialogue: Well, it's not exactly a plan, but I think I'm going to pass out.

00:16:34:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:34:200000.Dialogue: Sorry, can we please just do it one more time?

00:16:38:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:38:130000.Dialogue: One, two, one, two, three, and...

00:16:55:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:55:050000.Dialogue: It's a little thing, but you really do miss it.

00:16:59:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:59:020000.Dialogue: Hello, everyone. I brought my new friend Barry Kripke home for dinner.

00:17:17:140000.Speaker: Kripke
00:17:17:140000.Dialogue: You have a special spot? What kind of wacko are you?

00:17:30:150000.Speaker: Kripke
00:17:30:150000.Dialogue: Be right back. I got to floss the Indian food out of my teeth if I'm gonna eat Chinese.

00:17:39:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:39:210000.Dialogue: Yes, I pass out all the time,

00:17:42:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:42:190000.Dialogue: but it was worth it. I've made substantial progress in bonding with Kripke, which brings me to an awkward moment.

00:17:50:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:50:110000.Dialogue: Maintaing five friendships promises to be a Herculean task, so...

00:17:55:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:55:230000.Dialogue: I'm going to have to let one of you go.

00:18:00:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:00:160000.Dialogue: Me, me, let it be me.

00:18:04:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:04:230000.Dialogue: Leonard, you are my roommate, my source of transportation, and you help me fold my sheets when they come out of the dryer. You are safe.

00:18:20:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:20:110000.Dialogue: You do not have a PhD; your cologne is an assault on the senses;

00:18:26:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:26:030000.Dialogue: and you're not available for video games during the Jewish high holidays.

00:18:36:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:36:040000.Dialogue: Come on. What do I have to do?

00:18:39:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:39:150000.Dialogue: Okay, you know what? I see where this is going. I'm not one of you guys. I'm not a scientist, so just tell me...

00:18:44:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:44:210000.Dialogue: Everything you're saying is true, but please allow me to continue. You're out.

00:18:55:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:55:190000.Dialogue: That's a good question. While you do provide a certain cultural diversity to an otherwise homogenous group, your responses to the questionnaire were truly disturbing. How could you for a moment think my favorite amino acid is glutamine?

00:19:11:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:11:060000.Dialogue: He had lysine, but changed it.

00:19:18:150000.Speaker: Kripke
00:19:18:150000.Dialogue: I like to floss before I eat so my gum pockets are open for new food.

00:19:30:230000.Speaker: Kripke
00:19:30:230000.Dialogue: How did I walk past you? I'm Barry. That's not a very hot name.

00:19:38:190000.Speaker: Kripke
00:19:38:190000.Dialogue: I'm going to call you Roxanne.

00:19:45:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:45:060000.Dialogue: Suddenly, I'm looking pretty good, huh?

00:19:51:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:51:050000.Dialogue: So, Kripke, I was wondering if there's any chance you could get me some time on the open science grid computer? But we're friends.

00:20:07:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:07:150000.Dialogue: I'm confused. I was given to understand that you allow your friends time on the machine.

00:20:12:190000.Speaker: Kripke
00:20:12:190000.Dialogue: No, that's wrong. There's an official schedule. I have no control over it.

00:20:20:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:20:160000.Dialogue: This entire endeavor seems to have been an exercise in futility. Raj, you're back in.

00:20:36:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:20:36:200000.Dialogue: You've got to give him credit for sticking with it.

00:20:40:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:40:100000.Dialogue: I didn't think he had it in him.

00:20:43:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:20:43:020000.Dialogue: And he almost made it to the top this time.
